passages.text: The kingdom of God is within you.
passages.context: Not a place to go but a reality to discover inside. The kingdom isn't coming — it's already here, within.

passages.text: Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.
passages.context: The first beatitude: spiritual poverty — emptiness, not-knowing — is the door to the kingdom.

passages.text: Love your enemies and pray for those who persecute you.
passages.context: The radical ethic: love isn't reserved for those who deserve it. Extend it precisely where it's hardest.

passages.text: For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for my sake will find it.
passages.context: The great paradox: grasping destroys; releasing discovers. Die to find life.

passages.text: Consider the lilies of the field, how they grow: they neither toil nor spin, yet I tell you, even Solomon in all his glory was not arrayed like one of these.
passages.context: Nature as teacher of trust. Anxiety is unnecessary — look at the flowers.

passages.text: Judge not, that you be not judged. For with the judgment you pronounce you will be judged.
passages.context: Judgment returns to the judge. The measure you use measures you.

passages.text: Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you.
passages.context: The invitation to active engagement. Ask, seek, knock — the universe responds to initiative.

passages.text: Why do you see the speck that is in your brother's eye, but do not notice the log that is in your own eye?
passages.context: We magnify others' faults while blind to our own. Self-examination precedes correction of others.

passages.text: The truth will set you free.
passages.context: Truth as liberator. Bondage is ignorance; freedom is seeing what's real.

passages.text: I am the way, the truth, and the life.
passages.context: Not just teaching the way but being it. The path isn't separate from the one walking it.

passages.text: Let the one among you who is without sin be the first to throw a stone.
passages.context: Disarming accusation with self-examination. No one is qualified to condemn.

passages.text: The last will be first, and the first will be last.
passages.context: Kingdom economics invert worldly hierarchies. Status here means nothing there.

passages.text: Unless you change and become like little children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven.
passages.context: Adult sophistication blocks entry. The child's openness, trust, and wonder are prerequisites.

passages.text: Father, forgive them, for they know not what they do.
passages.context: Forgiveness at the moment of murder. They don't understand — that's grounds for pardon, not condemnation.

passages.text: A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another: just as I have loved you, you also are to love one another.
passages.context: The new law: love as I have loved. Not abstract love but concrete, sacrificial, embodied.

passages.text: Do not be anxious about tomorrow, for tomorrow will be anxious for itself. Sufficient for the day is its own trouble.
passages.context: Today has enough to handle. Don't borrow tomorrow's problems. Present focus, not future worry.

passages.text: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the kingdom of God.
passages.context: Wealth as obstacle. Possessions possess; they make entry into the kingdom nearly impossible.

passages.text: What does it profit a man to gain the whole world and forfeit his soul?
passages.context: The ultimate bad trade: everything for nothing. What's the exchange rate between world and soul?

passages.text: The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field. It is the smallest of all seeds, but when it has grown it is larger than all the garden plants.
passages.context: Tiny beginnings, vast endings. The kingdom starts invisibly small and becomes shelter for all.

passages.text: Where your treasure is, there your heart will be also.
passages.context: Heart follows treasure. What you invest in captures you. Choose your treasures carefully.

passages.text: You are the light of the world. A city set on a hill cannot be hidden.
passages.context: You ARE light — not will be, are. Light can't hide itself. Shine by being what you are.

passages.text: Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden, and I will give you rest. For my yoke is easy, and my burden is light.
passages.context: Invitation to the weary. The way isn't more burden but different burden — one that lightens rather than crushes.
